description: Unadapted borrowing from Latin fossa (“a ditch, trench, fosse”). Doublet of fosse.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A pit, groove, cavity, or depression.
examples: Hyponyms: cubital fossa, fossa of Rosenmüller, glenoid fossa, iliac fossa, incisive fossa, infratemporal fossa, nasal fossa, piriform fossa, popliteal fossa, pterygopalatine fossa, rhomboid fossa, suprainiac fossa, temporal fossa

entries.meaning: (astronomy) A long, narrow, shallow depression on the body of an extraterrestrial body, such as a planet or moon.

description: Borrowing from Malagasy fosa which likely once referred to the Malayan weasel (Mustela nudipes) prior to a semantic shift, thus cognate with Malay pusak and Tagalog pusa both meaning "cat".

entries.meaning: A large nocturnal reddish-brown catlike mammal (Cryptoprocta ferox) of the civet family, endemic to the rainforests of Madagascar. It is slender, long-tailed and has retractile claws and anal scent glands.
